page.title: 08TUXFORD 3 +ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS
page.content:
ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS
Our thanks to:
l. Mr. Atkinson, h/t Tuxford Comp. 2. The staff Tuxford Comp. School 3. Linda and staff at Saundby Welding 4. Mr. Cooke at Kenneth Wilsons 5. Mrs. Johnson,Farrell,Lancaster,and mums who accomp'ed kids on visits. 6. Mrs. Brancham for typing. 7. Primary school staff,especially Mr.K.Smith who edited this submission. { TUXFORD (cont) (727O-727l) Apart from the old camp site this area is devoted to arable agriculture. The main crops grown in the area are wheat,barley, an increasing amount of (oil seed) rape with some sugar beet, turnips and swedes. The old camp at Tuxford is now an indust: area, the main occupant
